item.title: Dona add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "This is the trouble with all happiness -all of it is built on top of something men want." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Dona add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Dona add a quote by Amy Chua
item.description: "Nothing is fun until you're good at it." -- Amy Chua

item.title: Dona add a quote by Stacy Schiff
item.description: "As always, an educated woman was a dangerous woman." -- Stacy Schiff

item.title: Dona add a quote by Rebecca Stead
item.description: "Well, it's simple to love someone," she said. "But it's hard to know when you need to say it out loud." -- Rebecca Stead

item.title: Dona add a quote by Joshua Foer
item.description: "It is forgetting, not remembering, that is the essence of what makes us human. To make sense of the world, we must filter it. "To think," Borges writes, "is to forget." -- Joshua Foer

item.title: Dona add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "I'd rather be partly great than entirely useless." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Dona add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Dona add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "The only use she has for the word fun is to make the word funeral." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Dona add a quote by François Rabelais
item.description: "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." -- François Rabelais

item.title: Dona add a quote by Cath Crowley
item.description: "When wanting collides with getting, that's the moment of truth. I want to collide." -- Cath Crowley

item.title: Dona add a quote by Cath Crowley
item.description: "I like that about art, that what you see is sometimes more about who you are than what's on the wall." -- Cath Crowley

item.title: Dona add a quote by Cath Crowley
item.description: "It's harder to make someone laugh than it is to make them cry." -- Cath Crowley

item.title: Dona add a quote by Justina Chen Headley
item.description: "Inertia is <i>so</i> easy—don't fix what's not broken. Leave well enough alone. So we end up accepting what <i>is</i> broken, mistaking complaining for action, procrastinating for deliberation." -- Justina Chen Headley

item.title: Dona add a quote by Laini Taylor
item.description: "Karou wished she could be the kind of girl who was complete unto herself, comfortable in solitude, serene. But she wasn't. She was lonely, and she feared the missingness within her as if it might expand and... cancel her. She craved a presence beside her, solid. Fingertips light at the nape of her neck and a voice meeting hers in the dark. Someone who would wait with an umbrella to walk her home in the rain, and smile like sunshine when he saw her coming. Who would dance with her on her balcony, keep his promises and know her secrets, and make a tiny world wherever he was, with just her and his arms and his whisper and her trust." -- Laini Taylor

item.title: Dona add a quote by Tiffany Truitt
item.description: "Stories enabled you to forget your life and your limits. They urged you to reach for a world that was never meant to be yours. There was nothing more dangerous than an imagination." -- Tiffany Truitt

item.title: Dona add a quote by Tiffany Truitt
item.description: "Maybe it's better to live in a world you don't understand, because if you understand it, it becomes unbearable." -- Tiffany Truitt

item.title: Dona add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description:
"When you look at what C.S. Lewis is saying, his message is so anti-life, so cruel, so unjust. The view that the Narnia books have for the material world is one of almost undisguised contempt. At one point, the old professor says, ‘It’s all in Plato’ — meaning that the physical world we see around us is the crude, shabby, imperfect, second-rate copy of something much better. I want to emphasize the simple physical truth of things, the absolute primacy of the material life, rather than the spiritual or the afterlife.
[<i>The New York Times interview, 2000</i>]" -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Dona add a quote by George Saunders
item.description: "Don't be afraid to be confused. Try to remain permanently confused. Anything is possible. Stay open, forever, so open it hurts, and then open up some more, until the day you die, world without end, amen." -- George Saunders
